description: Several Tesla vehicles were set on fire at a Las Vegas service center using Molotov cocktails. The word 'RESIST' was spray-painted on the building. Authorities are investigating it as a targeted attack.

newsLinks.title: FBI investigating Tesla vehicles shot and set on fire at facility in Las Vegas
Teslas set on fire at Las Vegas repair shop in latest incident of vandalism targeting company

description: Two Tesla Cybertrucks were found burned at a Kansas City Tesla dealership lot in a likely arson incident.

description: Coordinated nationwide protests: Hundreds protested at Tesla dealerships across multiple states, with peaceful demonstrations and some minor scuffles.

newsLinks.title: DoJ says attacks on Tesla stores are 'domestic terrorism' as more incidents emerge

description: Drive-by shooting (2nd incident): One week after the first, the Tigard Tesla store was attacked again before dawn with 10–15 shots, causing extensive damage.

description: Three Tesla vehicles were vandalized overnight at a service center in Dedham. Two Tesla Cybertrucks had words spray-painted on them, and all four tires on those trucks, as well as on a Tesla Model S, were slashed or damaged.

newsLinks.title: 3 Teslas vandalized at dealership in Dedham, police say

description: A blaze destroyed four Tesla Cybertrucks parked at a Tesla lot in Seattle.

description: 'Tesla Takedown' rally: Over 350 protesters gathered outside the Tesla showroom, occupying it and forcing a shutdown. NYPD arrested 6 people.

description: Molotov attack & arrest: A 24-year-old man threw incendiary devices at a Tesla charging station and accidentally set himself on fire.

Keying incident at Dallas-Fort Worth Airport: A Tesla’s cameras recorded a man keying the car’s paint in the parking lot around 4:15 PM. The owner filed a police report and posted the video online, which went viral (even retweeted by Donald Trump Jr.). Police are investigating, and the incident highlights growing anti-Tesla sentiment.

newsLinks.title: Viral video shows man keying Tesla in Dallas as attacks on company, Elon Musk grow nationwide
